instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not Turning On
threads.message:
Hello,

I have a MacBook Pro Retina here where it does not turn after going to sleep for a long period of time. The only way to get it up and running again is if I disconnect the battery and reconnect with or without charger. The power button does work as I can turn it off forcefully or gracefully and able to turn on with the button.

Where should I begin troubleshooting this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not Turning On
threads.message:
Try PRAM reset mfirst.

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal when doesn't want to resume from sleep.
Is <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> still high then?
